subject: Politics
title: Locke and Limited Government
description: A micro-lesson that makes Locke and Limited Government usable.

hook.text: Locke said government exists to serve the people, not the other way around. Disobey a tyrant â€” it's your right.

buildup.text: Locke argued for natural rights: life, liberty, and property. Government must protect them or lose legitimacy.

discovery.text: His 'Two Treatises of Government' directly influenced the American Declaration of Independence and the US Constitution.

twist.text: Locke's vision of property rights excluded indigenous peoples. His 'freedom' was limited to propertied European men.

climax.text: Despite its limits, Locke's framework built modern liberal democracy: consent of the governed and limited power.

punchline.text: Locke made government the servant. That idea changed the world.

quiz.question: What did Locke argue happens when government fails to protect natural rights?
options: It loses legitimacy and the people have the right to rebel
Nothing, because government authority is always absolute
Citizens must wait for the next election cycle
